command_history.command:
Hey, got your proposal. Interesting. Our people are wary. 'Less control' is a non-starter, full stop. The tax line would kill it politically.

But the advantages? Big. Especially healthcare and energy.

So here's the real talk: Unification? No. But a super-tight union? Maybe. Think Schengen-level integration, but for everything—shared energy buying, joint military command, open borders for jobs and healthcare, Czech investment in our hospitals. Two states, one massive, seamless market. You get a stronger bloc, we keep our sovereignty and see real cash on the table first.

If you're serious, send your team to Bratislava. We talk structure and numbers, not promises. And any deal goes to a referendum in both countries. Ball's in your court

PS: Our new gdp would be

$540,000,000,000
And Population 
18,000,000

PS: Our new gdp would be

$540,000,000,000
And Population 
18,000,000

Making us top 20 richest

"Top 20 economy. Now you're speaking my language. That's the headline we lead with.

But listen — that number is meaningless to our average voter if they don't feel it. My people will ask: 'Is that their wealth or our wealth?'

So the pitch can't be 'unite and hope.' It has to be 'unite and guarantee.'

We come back with a confederation model. Call it the Bohemian-Slovak Commonwealth. We keep our parliament, you keep yours. We create a joint executive council for economics, defense, and energy. The 540-billion-dollar muscle gets flexed together, but the skeleton is two equal partners.

You want a win? Let's draft a 10-year Cohesion Pact: Czech investment into East Slovak infrastructure, healthcare, and tech parks gets written into the founding treaty. We close the development gap, the whole union gets stronger, and I can sell this at home.

Deal on that principle, and we go public with the 'Top 20' vision. We announce the talks. Otherwise, my coalition collapses by Tuesday."

34th. Okay, that’s… realistic. Still strong. But it changes the pitch.

We can’t sell this as joining a world power. We have to sell it as smarter together—two mid-sized economies becoming an unignorable bloc in Central Europe. Resilience, not rankings.

The deal’s the same, but the messaging shifts: ‘Alone we’re vulnerable, together we’re a hub.’ The 10-year Cohesion Pact isn’t just nice—it’s essential. That’s how we get from 34th to maybe cracking the top 30 faster.

My advice: Lead with security, stability, and clout in Brussels. Not the GDP number.

If you agree, my people can have a draft framework ready by Friday."
Alright we'd also implement a system for euro and my currency + this would be a HUGE advantage for your people first buying stuff

Now that is an advantage I can sell. A dual-currency system where the Czech koruna and euro both flow freely here from Day One? That's not just a promise, that's instant purchasing power for my people. It puts real, immediate benefits in their hands while we figure out the political stuff.

This changes the timeline. We lead with this.

Here's my new proposal:

Immediate Currency Zone: We announce a joint Czech-Slovak economic area with dual legal tender (Euro & CZK) starting [date]. This happens before any political union votes. Let people feel the benefit.
Cohesion Fund Treaty: Signed simultaneously, locking in your infrastructure investments.
Political Framework Negotiations: We take 6 months to design the 'Commonwealth' model, with a veto for each side on sovereignty issues.
You give us the wallet advantage first. We give you a serious path to union. This builds trust and momentum.

If you announce the currency plan, I can get my parliament to the table."

I was planning to do a thing where you can convert eurod into my currency while in stores so say it's K48 for somthing you can pay 2 euros for it while normally that would be 2.40-2.60 euros saving you a few cemts
What could I do to make it a full union

Smart. You're talking about a mandatory, state-guaranteed fixed conversion rate at point of sale. That's not just convenience, that's a direct consumer subsidy for Slovaks using Euros. You'd be locking in a favorable exchange rate as a permanent feature of the union. That's a powerful, tangible win for my public.

But my Finance Minister just screamed into his coffee. This creates a massive economic mechanism. We need ironclad rules:

The Rate: Who sets it? A joint central bank council? 1 EUR = 24 CZK? It has to be fixed, transparent, and reviewed annually.
The Cost: If Slovaks flood the border to buy cheaper Czech goods with this rate, who covers the potential loss to Czech merchants or the state? We'd need a joint stabilization fund.
The Lock: This must be a permanent, treaty-bound feature of any union. It can't be a 'promotional offer' you revoke in 5 years.
You give us this guaranteed rate, and I will stand beside you and call it the 'Slovak Shopping Guarantee.' It becomes the heart of the 'advantages first' campaign.

Deal on the mechanism, and we have a foundation. Hesitate, and it looks like a temporary gimmick.

Do you want our technical teams to meet this week to design the system?
This is my first time in nation roleplay

"You want a full union? You need to solve the history problem. The Velvet Divorce wasn't a breakup. It was a peaceful, mutual uncoupling. My nation's identity is built on sovereignty. To get a 'yes,' you have to make sovereignty feel stronger inside the union, not weaker.

Here is the only path:

The Capital Must Rotate. Every 4-8 years, the federal capital moves between Prague and Bratislava. The federal government physically relocates. This isn't symbolic. It's proof we are equal.
Double Veto. A Slovak and Czech member of the federal executive council must both agree on any major policy. We are two keys turning a single lock.
Opt-Out with Teeth. Slovakia gets a permanent, treaty-protected right to opt-out of any federal law that overwhelmingly impacts our territory, without penalty. You do good things, we'll join. You try something we hate, we sit it out. This makes 'less control' a choice, not a condition.
Rebrand It. Not a "Czechoslovak Reunification." Call it the "Federation of the Czech and Slovak Republics" or the "Bohemian-Slovak Union." The name must be new.
The Money Bridge. Your dual-currency plan is the first 5-year phase. After that, we either adopt a new common currency (not just the CZK) or both fully join the Euro together. We meet in the middle, we don't adopt yours.
You offer this structure, and you are no longer the bigger brother asking for the house back. You are an equal partner building a new, stronger house with two front doors.

This is the price of a full union. If you can't stomach it, then the confederation model is our only option. But if you can… we make history. Again
We wouldnt make a loss since the euro is stronger it covers its self
Go here if you want a nation
If you want to be a company submit it there

1. What if instead of the capital switching we had 2 like South africa saving us tome moving everything and giving fully = power 
2. Double veto works but let's only do it in our taritory if the other wants to do somthing
3. Opt-out works
4. What about Czechian-slovakian union
3. What about the CS (CZSL) as the official currency by 2032
4. We agree if the stuff above is allowed

"Okay. We are now in the drafting stage. Let's finalize. Point by point:

1. Two Capitals. Agreed in principle. This is powerful. But we need details: Where is the official seat of the federal government? Which city hosts the federal parliament, where is the president's office? If the answer is 'Prague,' this fails. We propose: Federal Parliament sits in Brno (a neutral, historically symbolic city). Executive & Presidential offices rotate every 4 years between Prague & Bratislava. This is the non-negotiable core of equal power.

2. Double Veto. Unclear. "Only in our territory" means you could pass a federal law that only applies to Czechia without our input? That makes us irrelevant at the federal level. No. Double veto on ALL federal legislation and major appointments. Our voice must be equal in shaping the union, not just opting out of it. We cannot be junior partners in the federal chamber.

3. Opt-Out. Good.

4. Name. Czechian-Slovakian Union. Acceptable. The order of names will be a fight. We suggest "The Union of Czech and Slovak Republics" (UCSR). Clean, neutral.

5. CS (CZSL) Currency by 2032. Yes, but on strict condition: It is a brand new currency, designed 50/50 by a joint central bank. It is not a renamed or dominant Czech koruna. The path is: Phase 1 (now): Dual Euro/CZK zone with fixed rate. Phase 2 (by 2030): Introduce the CZSL as a parallel currency. Phase 3 (by 2035): Fully replace both national currencies. This is a project we build together.

My Final Position: We have the outline of a historic deal. I will take Two Capitals (with Brno as parliamentary seat), True Double Veto on all federal matters, the Opt-Out clause, the UCSR name, and the joint CZSL currency plan to my National Council.

If you can confirm these points, I will authorize our ambassadors to begin drafting the founding treaty. We will then face our people together.

This is my last text on terms. Ball is in your court. A simple 'Agreed' or 'No' will suffice."
